item.title: 埃尔根需要曾被他唾弃的债权人来完成 Dish-DirecTV 交易
item.description: 查理-厄根（Charlie Ergen）几十年来一直梦想着将他的卫星电视公司 Dish Network Corp. 与竞争对手 DirecTV 合并，但这取决于他过去曾惹恼过的债权人是否愿意注销他们在这家负债累累的公司的部分投资。【原文：Charlie Ergen’s decades-long dream to combine his satellite-TV company Dish Network Corp. with rival DirecTV hinges on the willingness of creditors he has irked in the past to write off part of their investment in the heavily indebted company.】

item.title: Cerebras 提交上市申请，挑战英伟达的人工智能芯片制造技术
item.description: 希望在人工智能计算领域挑战英伟达公司的初创企业 Cerebras Systems Inc.【原文：Cerebras Systems Inc., a startup that looks to challenge Nvidia Corp. in artificial intelligence computing, has filed for an initial public offering.】

item.title: 西门子支付 1.04 亿美元解决司法部商业秘密调查案
item.description: 西门子能源股份公司（Siemens Energy AG）的一家美国子公司同意支付 1.04 亿美元，以解决对其盗用竞争对手机密信息以赢得投标的刑事调查。【原文：A US subsidiary of Siemens Energy AG agreed to pay $104 million to resolve a criminal investigation into misappropriating confidential information from competitors to win a bidding process.】

item.title: 安德鲁-勒夫的香橼重返研究领域，看涨监狱行业
item.description: 香橼研究公司（Citron Research）在周一的一份报告中回到了一个熟悉的主题，即监狱是一个看涨的赌注，这是该公司自其创始人安德鲁-莱夫特（Andrew Left）今年 7 月被指控犯有证券欺诈罪以来的第一份报告。【原文：Citron Research returned to a familiar theme, that prisons are a bullish bet, in a report Monday, the firm’s first since its founder Andrew Left was charged with securities fraud in July.】

item.title: 短篇小说作家安德鲁-莱福特（Andrew Left）预告了《小冲突中的辩护》，多写了 3,000 多字
item.description: 做空者安德鲁-莱福特（Andrew Left）正准备寻求驳回美国证券交易委员会对其交易活动提起的诉讼，他的律师将这起民事案件称为不合格的 "新奇事物"。【原文：Short seller Andrew Left is gearing up to seek dismissal of a US Securities and Exchange Commission lawsuit over his trading activities, with his lawyer characterizing the civil case as a substandard “novelty.”】

item.title: 比特币跌回 65,000 美元下方，9 月以下跌收尾
item.description: 比特币以跌势结束了 9 月份最大的一次反弹，回落到 65,000 美元以下，削弱了人们对该加密货币历史上回报率最好的月份的乐观情绪。【原文：Bitcoin is closing out one of its biggest September rallies on a down note, dropping back below $65,000 and undercutting optimism going into what has historically been the cryptocurrency’s best month for returns.】

item.title: PG&E 因北加州野火风险而断电
item.description: PG&E 公司说，它切断了北加州数千名用户的电力供应，以防止其设备在干燥的狂风中引发野火。【原文：PG&E Corp. said it cut power to several thousand customers in Northern California to prevent its equipment from sparking wildfires during gusty, dry winds.】

item.title: 巴里克称已与马里达成协议，此前有报道称工作人员被拘留
item.description: 巴里克黄金公司（Barrick Gold Corp.）和马里军方领导人已同意解决该公司在西非国家的资产纠纷。【原文：Barrick Gold Corp. and Mali’s military leadership have agreed to resolve a dispute over the company’s assets in the West African nation.】

item.title: 橄榄园业主达顿出售债券为收购 Chuy's 提供资金

item.title: AT&T 通过出售 DirecTV 标志着退出代价高昂的媒体市场
item.description: AT&T Inc.宣布出售其在卫星电视运营商 DirecTV 的剩余股份，最终退出代价高昂的娱乐业。【原文：AT&T Inc. announced its final exit from a costly plunge into the entertainment business with the sale of its remaining stake in satellite television operator DirecTV.】

item.title: 美联储关于银行储备的关键指标对流动性发出的信号喜忧参半
item.description: 美联储关于金融系统现金稀缺的一个关键指标正吸引着市场参与者的大量关注，他们正在寻找任何压力的证据。【原文：A key Federal Reserve indicator of scarcity of cash in the financial system is grabbing a lot of attention from market participants who are on the lookout for any evidence of stress.】

item.title: 痴迷美联储的美国交易员无法理解中国股市的复苏
item.description: 在新兴市场的鼎盛时期，突然出现的狂热将中国股市推向牛市将是华尔街的大新闻。【原文：Back in the emerging-market heyday, the sudden frenzy that has pushed Chinese equities to a bull run would be big news on Wall Street.】

item.title: 道明银行在更广泛的美国调查中解决国债欺骗案
item.description: 多伦多道明银行（Toronto-Dominion Bank）将支付 2,000 多万美元，作为与美国检察官和监管机构达成的协议的一部分，以解决对一名前交易员涉嫌下达 "恶搞 "指令操纵美国国债市场的调查。【原文：Toronto-Dominion Bank will pay more than $20 million as part of a deal with US prosecutors and regulators to resolve investigations over a former trader’s alleged placement of “spoof” orders to manipulate the US Treasuries market.】

item.title: 特朗普的加密货币企业开始注册，但商业目的仍不明朗
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普的 "世界自由金融"（World Liberty Financial）去中心化金融项目已经开始注册用户，尽管目前还不清楚该加密平台将提供哪些服务。【原文：Donald Trump’s World Liberty Financial decentralized finance project has started to sign up users even though it remains unclear what services the crypto platform will offer.】

item.title: 贸易商达成协议，向欧洲出口无森林砍伐的咖啡
item.description: 世界上最大的咖啡贸易商已经开始承担额外的风险：在最终规则出台之前，向欧洲销售不含森林砍伐的咖啡豆。【原文：The world’s largest coffee traders have started to take on an additional risk: selling deforestation-free beans to Europe before final rules are even laid out.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会声称，前廷戈审计师协助并隐瞒了 "大规模欺诈 "行为
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会指控一家尼日利亚审计公司掩盖了金融科技公司 Tingo Group Inc. 及其关联公司多年来夸大财务业绩、欺诈全球投资者的阴谋。【原文：The US Securities and Exchange Commission accused a Nigerian audit firm of covering up a years-long scheme by fintech Tingo Group Inc. and its affiliates to inflate their financial performance and defraud investors worldwide.】

item.title: Oura 年收入接近 5 亿美元，并准备推出新戒指
item.description: 芬兰健康技术公司Oura Health Oy以其健身追踪环而闻名，该公司今年的年销售额将翻一番，达到约5亿美元，并预计在2025年实现 "健康 "增长。【原文：Oura Health Oy, a Finnish health technology company known for its fitness-tracking rings, will see annual sales double this year to roughly $500 million and expects “healthy” growth in 2025.】

item.title: 美元连跌令交易员对美联储降息保持警惕
item.description: 在美联储最终开启降息周期后，美元创下了 20 个月来最长的月度连跌纪录，这加剧了货币交易员的焦虑情绪。【原文：The dollar’s longest monthly losing streak in 20 months is fueling anxiety among currency traders after the Federal Reserve finally embarked on its interest-rate cutting cycle.】

item.title: 英国保守党在平静的工作日后直面反对派现实
item.description: 英国保守党在今年的年度会议上一直在努力充实企业日活动，这与他们作为英国商业政党的自我品牌形成了鲜明对比。【原文：Britain’s Conservatives have struggled to fill out the corporate day event at their annual conference this year, in stark contrast to their self-branding as the UK’s party of business.】

item.description: 新成立的德克萨斯证券交易所表示，它已聘请了来自嘉信理财公司（Charles Schwab Corp.）、纳斯达克公司（Nasdaq Inc.【原文：The upstart Texas Stock Exchange said it had hired executives from Charles Schwab Corp., Nasdaq Inc. and the New York Stock Exchange as it builds up a leadership team ahead of plans to begin operations next year.】

item.title: 肯尼亚侨民债券可能有助于为备受争议的机场升级提供资金
item.description: 肯尼亚总理内阁秘书穆萨利亚-穆达瓦迪（Musalia Mudavadi）表示，肯尼亚计划出售的侨民债券可能会为关键的基础设施项目提供资金，包括拟扩建的肯尼亚最繁忙的机场。【原文：Kenya’s planned sale of a diaspora bond may fund key infrastructure projects including the proposed expansion of the nation’s busiest airport, according to Prime Cabinet Secretary Musalia Mudavadi.】

item.title: 加州人工智能法案遭否决，作者称问题 "不会消失
item.description: 加利福尼亚州有争议的人工智能安全法案的设计者表示，在州长加文-纽森周日决定否决该法案后，当地立法者将继续推动为人工智能技术设置防护栏。【原文：The architect of California’s controversial artificial intelligence safety bill said local lawmakers will continue pushing for guardrails on the technology after Governor Gavin Newsom’s decision Sunday to veto the legislation.】

item.title: 道富聘用纽约银行的费尔南德斯推动数字资产发展
item.description: 金融服务和银行业巨头道富公司任命 Vanessa Fernandes 为数字资产解决方案主管。【原文：Financial services and banking colossus State Street Corp. has named Vanessa Fernandes as head of Digital Asset Solutions.】

item.title: 印度推迟就遏制期权交易狂热的措施做出决定
item.description: 印度证券市场监管机构出人意料地没有宣布限制衍生品交易激增的措施，同时还对该国蓬勃发展的共同基金行业的规则进行了调整。【原文：India’s securities market regulator surprised investors by refraining from announcing measures to limit a surge in derivatives trading, even as it tinkered with rules for the nation’s booming mutual fund industry.】

item.title: 辉瑞将发行 5.4 亿股股票削减 Haleon 股份
item.description: 辉瑞公司计划出售价值 5.4 亿美元的 Haleon Plc 股份，以削减其在这家英国消费者保健巨头中的持股量。【原文：Pfizer Inc. plans to sell 540 million worth of shares in Haleon Plc, as it pares back its holding in the UK consumer health giant.】

item.title: Verizon 解决影响 10 万人的无线服务中断问题
item.description: Verizon 通信公司周一表示，该公司正在努力恢复约 10 万用户的移动服务。【原文：Verizon Communications Inc. said Monday it’s working to restore mobile service for an estimated 100,000 customers.】

item.title: 象牙海岸为下一年度可可收成确定高于加纳的价格
item.description: 象牙海岸已将支付给农民的可可价格提高到高于加纳的水平，但两国种植者的收入仍将远远低于全球市场。【原文：Ivory Coast has raised the price it pays farmers for their cocoa above Ghana, even as growers in both countries will continue to receive far less than the global market.】
